newsitem.title: USA: Sybase to unveil new products on April 7.
newsitem.headline: Sybase to unveil new products on April 7.

text.p: Sybase Inc plans a major announcement on April 7 to unveil products that are expected to drive the company's revenues in the second half of 1997, Chief Executive Mitchell Kertzman said on Friday.

Kertzman, who was chief executive of Powersoft until its 1995 merger with Sybase, said the products were aimed at bringing Sybase back into a leadership position in the database market. Kertzman joined Sybase last year.
He was speaking during a panel discussion at a Hambrecht & Quist investment conference in San Francisco.

The chief executive said the company's management has been "internally focused" on its turnaround efforts, but that would begin to change after Sybase's April 7 product announcement in Orlando, Florida.
"It's very hard to pole-vault out of a hole in the ground," Kertzman said, referring to the difficulties of turning around the company.
Sybase's new product initiatives have targeted areas necessary for Web application development, including the NetImpact Studio suite from Powersoft and a Web server known as Net Impact Dynamo.
The company's next database offering, SQL Server 11.1, is expected to add major technical and performance features, according to H&Q analysts. ((sam.perry@reuters.com, Palo Alto Bureau 415 846 5400))
